intro: Quivisia chilosantha, commonly known as the Chilean quivisia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to dry conditions with its succulent-like leaves. Quivisia chilosantha is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
